body:
you can always just have both int32 and int64 definitions inside a single "#define".

you can also "#define REGISTER_ONE_HOT_INDEX(type, index_type) ...." then "#define REGISTER_ONE_HOT(type) REGISTER_ONE_HOT_INDEX(type, int32); REGISTER_ONE_HOT_INDEX(type, int64)
body_html:
you can always just have both int32 and int64 definitions inside a single "#define".

you can also "#define REGISTER_ONE_HOT_INDEX(type, index_type) ...." then "#define REGISTER_ONE_HOT(type) REGISTER_ONE_HOT_INDEX(type, int32); REGISTER_ONE_HOT_INDEX(type, int64)
body_text:
you can always just have both int32 and int64 definitions inside a single "#define".
you can also "#define REGISTER_ONE_HOT_INDEX(type, index_type) ...." then "#define REGISTER_ONE_HOT(type) REGISTER_ONE_HOT_INDEX(type, int32); REGISTER_ONE_HOT_INDEX(type, int64)
